intro: Hieracium calocymum, commonly known as the golden hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and serrated. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium calocymum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
